CHAPTER 21 ■Religious Reasoning
There also seemed to be strong philosophical reasons for accepting pre-
destination. If God is omniscient, if he knows everything, he must have fore-
knowledge of his creatures‘ fates. That suggests that there is a fact of the
matter about what my fate will be, which is knowable with certainty well in
advance of my birth. It doesn’t follow from this that God
